```json
{"solution": {"Original category": "Sale", "Recorded category": "Purchase", "Original date": "2024-01-20", "Recorded date": "2024-01-20", "Original payment/receipt_status": "Paid", "Recorded payment/receipt_status": "Paid", "Original payment_method": "Cash", "Recorded payment_method": "Cash", "Original quantity": "1.0", "Recorded quantity": "1.0", "Original price": "596.76", "Recorded price": "657.03", "Original receive_method": "Cash", "Recorded receive_method": "Cash", "Original amount": "596.76", "Recorded amount": "739.87", "Original tax": "29.84", "Recorded tax": "598.0", "Original profit": "246.76", "Recorded profit": "246.76", "Original Preparer": "", "Recorded Preparer": "", "Original Approver": "", "Recorded Approver": "", "id": "Sale20240120062"}}
```
**Explanation**:

- Based on the invoice, this is a **Sale** transaction, but recorded_type is "Purchase".
- Invoice total is $596.76, but recorded_amount is $739.87.
- Unit price per invoice is $596.76, but recorded_unit_price is $657.03.
- Tax in invoice is $29.84, but recorded_tax_amount is $598.0.
- All other fields (date, status, method, qty, receive_method, profit, preparer/approver, etc.) are not specifically contradicted in this entry. 
- Only the above fields have internal inconsistency, so those are filled in.
